website_summaries.verdict: For less than a comparable machine, this one does it all,  from brewing an entire pot to a single cup via ground coffee or pod.
pros: Removable parts are all dishwasher safe
Each brewing function has its own visible water tank, which is easy to fill
Coffee can be brewed at regular strength or bold
Carafe warmer keeps coffee hot for 2 hours, then shuts off automatically
cons: Only the carafe side can be programmed
As it's a larger machine, it may not fit on smaller countertops

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy- leaks coffee regularly. Broke with in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this ever again. Twice (or more) a week the single coffee service side leaks out the front of the machine and spills grounds and hot coffee everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki and John Pranksters in Love

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: ****EDIT If I could change this to no stars I would I have this coffee maker for 3 months and it’s started to leak about 1/2 of the water you put in the reservoir. I have submitted a request for repair/replacement directly to Hamilton Beach today and will see how they respond.
customer_reviews.author: Booksalone

customer_reviews.title: This unit has water leak issues when brewing.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product on 8/12/2017 and today on 01/20/2018 the unit started leaking water out of the bottom when the brew cycle started. Now I get to go through the whole warranty issue as I have to pay for trans both to and from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Cole

customer_reviews.title: I changed this review because an $80 coffeemaker should last longer than 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I initially loved this coffeemaker and the flexibility offered by having the single-serve or the carafe in one device. That is until the unit blew out and poured water all over my counter... within the first 6 months of ownership. Since the warranty requires I pay all shipping both ways, and the manufacturer makes the sole determination as to what warranty applies, it was easier to go to Wal-mart - not buy the same one again - instead buy a Black & Decker Dial-a-brew that lets me choose the amount of coffee desired in the regular carafe and hit go.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W

customer_reviews.title: Only buy this if you like the taste of burnt coffee
customer_reviews.text: Only buy this if you like the taste of burnt coffee. The coffee pot side produces coffee that tastes burnt. The Single brew side is ok bust takes a while to make one cup. Not very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried the K cup many times thinking that I may be user error. NOPE! I have followed the instructions and EVERY SINGLE TIME I get coffee grounds in my cup. Not just a little but the whole K cup worth. Very disappointed as I got this for an up coming surgery that I’m having and will not be able to have caffeine but my husband can. I thought it was the perfect solution to not having two coffee pot makers on the counter. What a waist.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy L Owens

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT! This is a cheap piece of garbage. If you have read other reviews talking about the plastic smell, please take that to heart. I thought maybe they had a dud, and bought it anyway...big mistake. The smell is terrible. I tried everything from airing it out, cleaning, you name it, i tried it. Still the heating of the water is too much for this cheap plastic to handle causing your kitchen to stink, and a waste of coffee. Mine is going in the garbage. I hope Hamilton Beach reads these comments, and figures out they are making crap for their customers.
customer_reviews.author: C.Harmon

customer_reviews.title: First 2 months loved it. After 1st month had a few clogs ...
customer_reviews.text: First 2 months loved it. After 1st month had a few clogs in k cup, but no big deal. follow instructions to clear the grounds from the spike and all was fine. But, eventually water would not flow through on the k cup side. water would heat and gurgle like it wan't to flow through to make the coffee, but It just wouldn't flow. Too bad. we liked it, but luckily we are still under the return window by a week, so back it goes for refund.
customer_reviews.author: El Tejon

customer_reviews.title: 5 purchased - 5 coffee makers leaked
customer_reviews.text: I loved this coffee maker for its versatility of brewing a pot of coffee or being able to use pods. Between us and our extended family we have purchased 5 of these coffee makers. Every single one has leaked after just a few months of use. Ours now has begun leaking. The coffee stained the caulk along where our quartz counter meets the wall 😥 I would love to return it however it’s over the timeframe that I can return having bought on Amazon, so it’s just a waste of $$ now. Bummed...
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hill

customer_reviews.title: Never Buy This Machine.  Save Yourself The Aggravation.
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked great and after three months it quit. It died. Amazon could do nothing but refer us to the seller and manufacturer and we got ZERO RESPONSE FROM THEM. Not a single letter or number or character. Nothing. We were ignored. And I did not ask for a refund when I called on them. I wanted guidance. The machine worked well just up to the three month mark and then kaput. We thought maybe a re-set or something but we got no answer or acknowledgement. That is bad, bad, customer service. We have given up and purchased a new machine, different brand For Sure. We will be blogging about this. We are that upset and frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Jose G. Osuna

customer_reviews.title: Very nice coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: We wanted versatility and this has it! We can make all our coffee, tea and hot cocoa that we need. This isn’t a super fancy coffee maker, but if you have a lot of people who all drink something different this is perfect! We made a cup of decaf, a cup of hazelnut, hot cocoa, green tea and a pot of regular for our guests this morning and everyone was happy. It is easy to clean and when we are done for the day we keep the doors open so the unit will air dry nicely. I highly recommend this for families that have different tastes for their morning coffees. This can satisfy them all.
customer_reviews.author: DE Meiers

customer_reviews.title: I love that this is cheaper than expensive Keurig machines and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is cheaper than expensive Keurig machines and has a carafe side. It worked like a dream for a month and then the K-cup side started spewing grounds everywhere. So I cLled tech support and it worked for a few days and died again. Hamilton beach replaced the unit. Hopefully it will work longer than a month because it did work great. When using K-cup side they told me to keep the setting on bold as it’s a slower drip. FYI for those experiencing the same thing
customer_reviews.author: B. Esposito

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for this coffee maker but it ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this coffee maker but it has turned out in a short time to be a royal piece of junk. The single side has stopped working all together. saying the needle is clogged. The needle is not and never has it been clogged. It is simple to see and fix had that been the case but it's something far deeper in the machine that does not work. this machine has not been abused in anyway nor is this an unreasonable review. These units have a lot of trouble n this area just look on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The carafe side works just fine but the single serve "K Cup" side never worked very well from day one. The unit was spotty for several months and the quit working all together. I tried taking it apart to try to troubleshoot what might be going on and ended up breaking a small plastic piece. I'm sure that this has likely rendered the warrantynull and void. So at this point I think we have a regular carafe brewer that works ok but the other side is worthless. I think you are better trying something else if you want the dual functionality.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Weeks, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Be Cautious
customer_reviews.text: Product only worked on single serve side. After researching the issue, I found that there seemed to be a manufacturing problem with the carafe side. Many purchasers are having the same issue. There are plenty of YouTube videos on how to fix the issue, however it is not easy and very time consuming. I was very eager and excited to receive the product but it has not worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Destroys most K cups. Sent the junk back to Amazon. Found later that a lot of folks complained about this issue. The spike is not sharp enough to puncture the K cup and actually pushes the top in on the k cup and it makes a REAL MESS all over the counter. Don't waist your money.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Flexible use
customer_reviews.text: Really like our new coffee maker. I would have given 5 stars, except that the included 'gold' baskets are a nuisance to clean. After two puts, I put them aside. For the carafe, we use 10 cup paper filters & they work perfect. No messy coffee grounds clogging my sink. For the single cup use, we use a 'K cup' of Folger's. Again, no messy cleanup. Like the flexibility to make a single cup/travel mug or a full pot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Crapped on the last day of the warranty.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great coffee maker - until it wasn't. The thing started leaking water from the bottom of the maker halfway through a pot of coffee. I tried to file a claim, but the site wouldn't permit it ('An error occurred', and would only permit me to send an email. So when the company opens tomorrow, the coffee maker will no longer be under warranty. It's like it was scheduled to stop working. IF you don't mind paying for one year of use, go for it. It's a great pot. But if you expect 2 or 3 years from it, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stachowski

customer_reviews.title: KCup side broken after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo disappointed. My husband likes very strong coffee. I like donut k-cups. Perfect solution. Unfortunately -- the thing is now spewing coffee grounds on my k-cup side for no apparent reason. Extremely disappointed. This worked for about 4 months UPDATE: as of 3/2018 the drip coffee side is broken.
customer_reviews.author: PololvrTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: K-cups brewing video - how long it takes!
customer_reviews.text: The previous Hamilton Beach Flex Brew I owned had too many issues with the k-cup side of the brewer, but this newer designs had reduced those issues significantly! Having 2 seperate water reservoirs takes care of alot of headaches, and the simple snap-down k-cup insertion design makes this brewer almost idiot-proof! But, it's not perfect. You still have to verify that the inserted k-cup has been pierced on both top and bottom or you'll have hot water and coffee grinds go everywhere! Typically the k-cups side takes 45 seconds before water starts pouring and, for 8oz, another 45 seconds until it has finished.
customer_reviews.author: bigexxon

customer_reviews.title: Appeared to be a good value, but it only lasted 2 1/2 months before leaking onto the counter while brewing.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, brews a great pot of coffee. The single serve works well, just keep in mind that you fill the single brew reservoir when you need it. It is not an "on demand" brewer like the "K" model. The only downside is that the cover for the main reservoir gets in the way when you are filling it. Worked great for 2 1/2 months, then it started leaking water out the bottom onto the counter during brewing. "Amazing Deals" the seller refused the return, now I have to deal with Hamilton Beach for the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Gick

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father in law for his birthday. He loves it but it has now broken twice. The first time on the single cup side, returned, Amazon sent a new one. The replacement has now broken also, but on the carafe side. I'm having to call the manufacturer at this point for a replacement or refund.
customer_reviews.author: Julia M. Solar

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: K cups exploding, grounds and water everywhere (inside the machine and out). We tried multiple different brands of k cups since we bought a variety pack to go with it. After 4 tries we're done. We read the directions before beginning. Not happy at all. The pot side didn't impress either. Super slow too brew. The day we got it we submitted to return it for a faulty product. Don't waste your money or time. Also don't be misled by the almost 4 star rating. Most folks are changing their ratings after multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Two things to keep in mind -
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker fit just what we needed - my husband likes a carafe, but I didn't want to give up my flavored k-cups. Two items to be mindful of . . . if you are used to exclusively using a Keurig, as we were, the k-cup side of this machine is not as fast as that; great tasting brew, but the cycle it isn't as quick. The other issue is that if you brew a carafe, and then want to switch to the k-cup brew, the warming plate under the carafe will shut off. It's been working great, but I would have liked to have consider these points before I purchased this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Lacks convenience of a Keurig
customer_reviews.text: While this can use k-cups and other keurig compatible cups, it really works nothing like a Keurig. Rather than having a reservoir that it pulls from for each cup of coffee made, which is the key of the convenience of a Keurig, you have to measure the water for each mug you’re going to make and it essentially boils and brews each cup. I thought the value of this seemed like a great deal-to be able to both brew a pot or make a k-cup, but for the lack of convenience I wish I had spent the money on a single brew Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Loni

customer_reviews.title: Makes coffee that tastes like plastic.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker would be great but the plastic taste is terrible... I have tried everything to get rid of it. I have cleaned it 5 different ways and tried everything on youtube and other resources. I am sending it back because the outgassing taste in the coffee is so bad...it makes my coffee taste like swill and I am not sure that drinking coffee from this machine is safe. The coffee even smells like plastic.
customer_reviews.author: M. Adams

customer_reviews.title: This makes the best coffee !
customer_reviews.text: I am all about having morning coffee no matter what! This replaced an expensive carafe c-maker but I was surprised to notice that my coffee tastes better than ever. I love the convenience of choosing a carafe of coffee or just a single cup. It is noisy when it is working, but that is not an issue for me. It is quick brewing, keeps the carafe hot and you can see the level of water you just poured (unlike my older, more expensive machine where I could not view the water level). I use it all the time...great value.
customer_reviews.author: GeeCee

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee ... saves space
customer_reviews.text: Just what we were looking for to make carafes and single serving beverages. HB seems to have made an easy to use and affordable brewing machine with features usually found on higher end brands. Of course durability is key, and as we have learned more expensive features does not necessarily equate to longevity (in fact the opposite can be true). We’re hoping this a good compromise and that a long run is brewing! Update: We found when brewing the max amount there is sometimes grounds spillage into the carafe ... solution use the Bunn commercial 8-12 cup filter (found on Amazon) see pic above.
customer_reviews.author: CC from Kirkland (Seattle's Riviera)

customer_reviews.title: Quick ship
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for an older model of the same product. Everything works great. I think the people that say it leaks all over the counter are using the single serve pods and we have found that some of the pods are not sturdy enough and when you close the cover it crushes the pod rather than piecing the base. You can actually push those pods in manually to make sure the base is punctured before closing the cover. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Total piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this coffee machine. My girlfriend loves the K-cups and I just want to have my DD coffee in a travel mug. Well the K-cup part started spitting grounds into the cup then started overflowing out the top. We decided we were going to return it but said lets make a pot on the other side 1st. Half the pot fills with coffee and the rest is floating in the can where the coffee goes. Also overflowed onto the countertop and floor. I'm really pissed I threw away my trusty old pot when we set this junk up. Ran out and bought a plain K-cup kureg machine.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Love this dual purpose unit.
customer_reviews.text: Love the dual use of this pot! We are a family of coffee drinkers, so this pot is great for us. We all have coffee in the morning, so we make a full carafe that’s preset to brew. When we want an afternoon cup, we can make a pod. It fabulous! Both processes, pot and pod, work great. This is our third unit, we use it daily, several times and each unit tends to last about a year and a half with no issues. After that, the carafe side starts leaking from the water reservoir. To be honest, I ordered this unit in white because it is really hard to find even though my second unit is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Limited warranty
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this coffee maker in Jan of this year and the one cup side stopped working . I wrote to the company and they requested a picture of the bottom of the coffee pot, we sent that in and for a shipping fee of $12.95 they say they will send us a replacement. While I am not happy the machine stopped functioning in this time frame , I am pleased that the company is doing something about it and hope that the replacement lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. McCaffrey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee pot in June of 2019. Two months later the one cup option leaked so I started using the carafe side. Yesterday, I was cleaning it and the plug that allows coffee to enter the pot broke. I can not get a refund so Hamilton Beach offered to replace the parts but they want to charge me 5.95 to ship it. Not worth the shipping charge. I am going to buy another coffee marker.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review... Since my last review, this coffee maker has now started leaking. I mean everywhere it leaks. It's happening when using the carafe side. You press start and all the water just drains onto the counter top. I looked at previous reviews and I'm not alone, it appears. This has happened to lots of purchasers. So, now, I must deal with the manufacturer, pay for additional shipping on a new machine, assuming they replace the junk item I have, and deal with all that nonsense. Then, again, assuming they replace it with a new one, I'm left with another piece of junk! STAY AWAY FROM THIS PIECE OF JUNK. We've had it less that three months!
customer_reviews.author: kgod

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap don't buy it. After two and a half months I started having problems on the single cup serving side. I did everything Hamilton Beach said to do as far as cleaning filter but still had the same problem, the pump quit pumping. Now the coffee pot side doesn't work. Don't even want to give it one star but I guess I have to that's part of this rating.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great
customer_reviews.text: So far its a great coffee maker. If you do the single cup with grounds there is a fill line in there. Dont just fill it up... unless you like super duper very strong coffee... lol UPDATE. When received i hand washed pot. It dripped every time it poured. My daughter left it on with very little left so i put into dishwasher on high temp. It does NOT drip when pouring now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning don't buy this coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that I would save space and have the convenience of two coffee pots in one. Sadly the single pot didn't work right. First it took too long to perk, 2nd the coffee grounds spit out of the top of the machine and also left the ground in your coffee. I bought another one and will try that one. Wish me luck. Warning don't buy this product, it is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: M.Marie Beaudoin

customer_reviews.title: RESERVOIR LEAKS AFTER 3 WEEKS
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was going to be the answer to our office coffee fights, but a seal in the water reservoir broke in 3 weeks and now it's impossible to brew coffee from the carafe side -- it leaks like a sieve when you add water. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: DANGER-FIREHAZARD!!
customer_reviews.text: Nearly started a fire in my house. Not even 4 days old. In the kitchen my back was turned away from the coffee maker. I heard grinding motor noise, even though item was off but plugged in. I quickly unplugged from wall at about same time outlet sparked and black mark where item was once plugged. Good thing I have a surge protector outlet and I was in the kitchen when this happened, or else I believe I would of had a fire. Now none of the outlets that side of kitchen work and I need an electrician. This $75 maker is costing me a lot more should have purchase Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic coffee pot!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this appliance a few months now and are very happy with it. Every day we have a pot set for the morning and use the single cup frequently through the day for teas. We purchased the one with the stainless decanter and love it, coffee remains drinkable for several hours after brewing in the pot. Does take a few minutes longer than the Keurig we had, though not long enough to be an impact, no different in use than a good ole coffee pot from the last several decades. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lars K.

customer_reviews.title: It’s now leaking from the bottom
customer_reviews.text: This is my Second Hamilton Beach coffee maker. I gave my last one to my kids. I used it 5 years! No doubt they will get as many years of good joe as I did from it too. Update: Unfortunately this one has started leaking from the bottom and my return window has closed. It’s too much hassle to send it for repair and my coffee is too important to wait for it to make a trip to the manufacturer and back. I’m just going to buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Contessa Mcpike

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach 2-way coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and in two weeks it wasn't working. When we tried to make coffee we had water every where. I have contacted to company and have not heard from them. I consider this bad service.
customer_reviews.author: Marian I DeVoll

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee pot when my other one went up and I like the versatility of having a carafe also a pod option as well, although it brews really nice the coffee does not come out hot I end up having to microwave my coffee also it don't have a keep warm feature. I've also noticed that at the top of the stainless steel carafe it's coming apart, as you can see in the picture. I've had this pot now for about 3 months and there's no way it should come apart. Very disappointed in this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great coffeemaker - Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new coffeemaker and decided I wanted one that you could use the k-cups. I like that you can even just heat water with it! 2/16/18 - TWO WEEKS after the return window closed, the stupid thing quit working. Hmmm, looks like I will just take a hammer to it and bust it into pieces. Really??? THREE MONTHS and it’s nothing but junk.
customer_reviews.author: CAHummingbird

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: DO NOT PURCHASE unless you like to be annoyed! TERRIBLE product!!
customer_reviews.text: Stops working religiously after I make about 6 single serves of coffee. Customer service at Hamilton Beach keeps telling me to clean it, which I have done numerous times and now it does not work at all. Liquid just sits in reservoir. Contacted Amazon and they called Hamilton Beach to escalate the issue. Hamilton Beach will be charging me a $17 restocking fee to send it back! NO more Hamilton Beach products for me!
customer_reviews.author: Peg Geho

customer_reviews.title: It worked great the first few months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coffee maker about 6 months ago, to replace the older model we had of the same brand. Not please with it at all. It worked great the first few months, but now the water trickles through the machine and takes forever to brew. We have tried cleaning it to no avail. Will not buy this brand again and would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: TI

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY ISSUE - Broke after three months of use
customer_reviews.text: This is a versatile brewer that brews very good. It has two brew settings (regular and bold) where by the difference in the brew settings can truly be savored. The reason why I gave a 2-star rating is because mine broke just after three months of use. It's the single brewer that stopped working; the carafe brewer still works. I did all I can to reset the single brewer back to work but to no avail. I called the customer service and they promptly replaced my brewer. I can now again brew either by carafe of by a single brewer. Still, it broke in just three months; which is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Flaviano C. De Leon

customer_reviews.title: 5***** Love this and highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the model with the stainless carafe. I absolutely love this coffee maker. I waited 1 1/2 months to write review to give good info. This machine is sooo easy to operate/navigate. It has worked perfectly on every function be it carafe, single serve or kpod. The design is extremely thoughtful with the compartment for single/pod accessories built in. Brews a carafe very quickly. You must be patient when brewing kpods just like a keurig, water needs to preheat, etc. I couldn’t be happier and I took my time purchasing a multi functional brewing station, and price was really not a factor. The reviews on this machine sold me and I’m very satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna J. Essex

customer_reviews.title: Water Leak after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: At first my wife and I were happy. She likes reusable K-cups and I like to brew a pot. We use it every day. We are not rough on any of our appliances. Then, 5 months later, a huge leak appears on my counter. After taking the bottom cover off, I see the leak comes from a water line. I removed the clamps but can't get the water line off because it looks glued into place. Don't get this coffee pot, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hosstoka

customer_reviews.title: No warmer for carafe
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I had seen the review that mentioned the carafe had no warmer before purchasing this. We aren’t coffee snobs, but my boyfriend likes his coffee piping hot. He had to microwave every cupful he poured from the carafe, even when the coffee was freshly brewed. The kcup feature is a nice addition, but we shouldn’t have to rely on that alone for hot coffee. This was delivered on July 6th, and I ordered a replacement today, Sept 13. I made sure the new one has a warmer for the carafe. I mean, what the heck was this company thinking... producing a coffee pot with no warmer?!
customer_reviews.author: Taya

customer_reviews.title: The first one started to leak and against my better judgement I ordered the newest model thinking it would ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hamilton Beach Flex brew 2-Way Brewer. The first one started to leak and against my better judgement I ordered the newest model thinking it would be better. I can't find another coffee maker that will make a single serve travel mug size. It was horrible. Right after taking it out of the box, It leaked water all over my counter while pouring a cup of water in for my first coffee. It also had a piece of plastic chipped off the exterior. It is big, bulky and feels cheaply made. After ordering and returning this product, I will never again buy a Hamilton Beach product. Very disappointed. If I could give zero starts, I would!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K Deming

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after only 2 years!!
customer_reviews.text: I mostly loved this coffee pot for exactly 2 years - then it started majorly leaking from the bottom!!! A coffee pot should last more than 2 years. The other issue is the hinge on the main water reservoir broke on one side about 3 months after purchase, pretty flimsy. I was looking for a new duel coffee pot and it popped up “Amazon Recommends” - I sure don’t! I will spend a little more on one that doesn’t have a track record for leaks. If you read other (bad) reviews this is a fairly common issue.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Coffee k cups explode!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It hates coffee k cups. It makes a loud noise and then explodes. It's a disaster for coffee. It's just fine for hot cocoa and cider! Weirdest thing. We tried multiple kinds of k cups, too. Something about coffee grounds just doesn't work in this machine on the k cup side. We never used the garafe side. Seems I'm one day too late to return this. What are the odds.
customer_reviews.author: Rayray

customer_reviews.title: Save your money on this one!
customer_reviews.text: We have ours for less than 9 months and the printing is rubbed off on the button controls,...the hot water delivery hose just pops off and spews hot water all over the counter, the floor,the EVERYWHERE! Lovely to wake up to in the morning or in the middle of the night when stumbling around for a drink from the fridge. Three times this happened so far in less than nine months. 90 bucks for this POS!!!!!!!!!!! Never again will I purchase anything with the name,...HAMILTON BEACH.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Zeppelin

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. The stainless Carafe does not keep the coffee ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a few coffee makers. My last one was make by Cuisinart which worked for a long time. Then we bought a Keurig single brew. When I saw the Flexbrew I was very excited. I purchased the Hamilton Beach Flexbrew. Very disappointed. The stainless Carafe does not keep the coffee hot. I called Hamilton Beach. They told me the only way the Carafe will keep the coffee warm, not hot, is to fill the Carafe with hot water, for several minutes. You have to do this every time you make a pot of coffee. I asked if there is another stainless Carafe I could purchase, they said no. What an inconvenience and a pain. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED, again...
customer_reviews.text: This is our THIRD Hamilton Beach FlexBrew and you would think that I would learn after the first two.. First one stopped working, second started leaking water everywhere from the bottom and now, we have the model 49966 with the thermal carafe. You can barely read the writing on the buttons, coffee gets cold super fast and after it brews the warmer does not stay on for 2 hours, it shuts off right away...Third time was not a charm but an eye opener to look for a new brand...If I did not know any better, I would say I was charged $119 for a used coffee maker THAT DOES NOT WORK PROPERLY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Unit has a fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed the dual functionality of this machine. THat would be UNTIL I went to make a pot of coffee this morning and ended up with water everywhere, except in the coffee pot. Turns out the hose in the back of the machine comes loose so the water pours out of the back. To get to this little defect you have to take the machine apart. First step of that is taking the bottom off which requires a tri wing screwdriver. Ever heard of that? Me neither. Before you buy this, Google Hamilton Beach Flex Brew leaking; and if you do order it, go ahead and order the screw driver too, because you are going to need it.
customer_reviews.author: Doylehr

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 8 months - pause & serve never worked
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker worked fine, but the pause & serve never worked. When I went for my first cup each morning, while still brewing, the coffee continued to drip. Fine. However yesterday morning, I went for my first cup and found the carafe half full, the water reservoir empty, and the remaining water all over my kitchen counter. It is less than 8 months old. The K-cup side worked fine this morning. Will have to use that until I find a replacement to purchase. I looked up the warranty today. It is good for one year, but I have to pay shipping there AND shipping back. I purchased for $72 so this doesn't seem very cost effective to me.
customer_reviews.author: DAN LOWREY

customer_reviews.title: good coffee maker for the price
customer_reviews.text: My coffee maker came at reasonable speed. My husband loves the taste. He states his coffee has more flavor and not bitter. (We used same coffee and water). The only issues I have is - I don't like the pot, It spills when you pour. (unlike my ninja) and you fill the single serve side reservoir the amount you want to fill your coffee cup. I wished we could fill the reservoir full and choose what size coffee cup.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer brown

customer_reviews.title: Water tank leaking, and brewing lukewarm coffee after less than a year!
customer_reviews.text: Had the item for about 8 months. It worked well at first, and then we started noticing the coffee was brewing almost lukewarm at times. We just had to go out and buy a new coffee maker after this one began leaking water all over the counter from the water tank. After adding water in, or presetting the coffee for the next morning we were having to clean pools of water from under and around the machine. Not satisfied with this item at all and if I were able to return it, I would!
customer_reviews.author: McGee

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple months of very light use
customer_reviews.text: No longer brews coffee. Instead, it just leaks hot water all over the countertop. I used this coffee maker, perhaps, once per week for the 6 months that I owned it, otherwise it was completely untouched. Another complain I have is that the single cup setting doesn't work like a normal Keurig, where it will automatically pour a coffee of the right amount, instead it just keeps brewing until the tank is empty overflowing any cup you have. One must make sure that they put in the exact amount of water in the single serving tank to prevent it, which in my opinion, defeats the purpose, and convenience, of a single serving setting. Do not buy this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Biscoe

customer_reviews.title: Great 2-in-1 Unit
customer_reviews.text: This larger coffee pot does a great job brewing a pot or a single cup. My family uses the k-cup, single serve diy, and the full pot feature. The mesh filters are nice. The diy single serve filter is a little difficult to rinse clean of coffee grounds. One of my favorite features is the nearly spill proof carafe. Unlike previous carafes I have used, this one doesn't dribble down the side and spill on the counter. Even when quickly filling the machine for the next day, the carafe does not spill. I do with it would keep the carafe warm longer than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Strikes and your Out
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit Twice and had problems both times. First I purchased it on Amazon hooked it up and water started leaking all over the kitchen counter so I sent it back for a refund. I then went to Wallmart and purchased another unit and it lasted about six months and it is slowly dieing and it takes forever to make a pot of coffee. When it was working I thought it was great, but six months is not a long time for the money I paid. I do not recommend Hamilton Beach coffee makers, they lure you with the price.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaMagic

customer_reviews.title: Comparably inexpensive, easy to use, works GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best coffee maker I have ever had. I have had all kinds in the past (Mr. Coffee, KitchenAide, others) and they do not compare. Large, unmistakable buttons, easy setup for time and auto timing. Great pot that actually does NOT drip down the side. The reservoir for the K-Cup is "custom" ....whatever cup you use, you just have to use that amount of water, and it is "hot" coffee; great for my travel mug. Works great for a cup of tea, too. I would be considered a heavy coffee drinker and I could not recommend this more highly.
customer_reviews.author: DrB

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for pods!!!! DO NOT PURCHASE for using pods!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several top name brand coffee pods in the Hamilton Flexbrew, and 98% of the time I get coffee grounds in my coffee mug. The pods either explode or leak. Makes a decent carafe of coffee, but terrible experience with using the single serve side with any brand of pod. I know that it isn't a Keurig, but I have never had a pod leak or explode in all of my times using Keurig or other brand single serve type units. Not even 1 month old and I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Humphries

customer_reviews.title: Revised review quit working 5 months
customer_reviews.text: So used the k cup side only after 5 months keep getting clean needle error when needle is clean. So decided to use the carafe side 3 brews later water heats up but does not dispense into carafe get a couple tablespoons then turns off. Seems like the pump motor isn't working on that side. Don't waste your money. Like the bold brew option helps with the weaker k cup coffees like Victor Allen when you are brewing 14 Oz is a little loud on brew cycle like the storage space for the small basket
customer_reviews.author: Janice Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Won't Do K-Cups
customer_reviews.text: Due to the top gasket on the single brew side of the unit, it leaks when brewing K-cups. There are coffee grounds in the cup and all over the counter. I have bought three of them and two leaked, one is OK. I tried replacing the gasket from my Keurig coffee maker, but ti was too thick and pierced the top of the cup. I think a smaller diameter gasket or a larger diameter ring gasket would work.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Fulk

customer_reviews.title: K-Cups Explode Rendering Purchase Pointless
customer_reviews.text: Two months after purchase, the single brew side gave out. It comes with directions for cleaning with needles and all kinds of ridiculous 'work'. Did everything repeatedly and there is no blockage but, every time a K-cup is used (and only the good ones), the cup explodes in the machine. This makes a horrible mess and does not result in coffee. Carafe side works fine but overall this is trash. Too bad it worked until it could no longer be returned. Great planning to have the integrated machine. Poor execution on delivering quality or reliability.
customer_reviews.author: JG - DFW, TX

customer_reviews.title: If you love acidity in your coffee this one's for you
customer_reviews.text: We were attracted by the thermal carafe and the single cup brewing. Unfortunately the coffee is dreadful. The water temp is so high that it turns the coffee we have used for years into an acid bath for my stomach. It's an attractive coffee maker but unfortunately we are returning it as I've resorted to drinking instant rather than brew the acid coffee in this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Reba A

customer_reviews.title: Wasted My Money! ☹️
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Feb. 2019. Worked great & loved it for about 4 months. Kept all parts clean, as directed. Then about 4 months later, it started exploding pods a making a huge mess about every 3rd time. Now it’s every time. I would have thrown it in the trash, but it was an expensive purchase. No matter the pod brand, it keeps doing it. Takes a lot of time to clean up the mess! I don’t have time for this! This Hamilton Beach product stinks!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Babcock

customer_reviews.title: 2 THUMBS UP FOR VERSATILITY!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually take the time to review items I have purchased. But I am so happy to have purchased this particular coffee maker! I thought that the single serve was only for short cups... The small compartment below the cup seat, (which serves as a storage compartment as well) is removable so that a tall cup can be used as well. I love that I can make one cup alone without making it in the carafe. It's also very easy to keep clean. This coffee maker is worth every penny I spent. I would buy it again. :n)
customer_reviews.author: Patience :D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade from  O' Leaky aka Mr. Coffee...
customer_reviews.text: This maker had everything that I wanted: Stainless steel carafe (and it does NOT drip!) Single serve coffee (without Keurig) Single serve coffee (with Keurig) Single serve hot water (for tea) The carafe pours without dripping! One thing that I like that I did not expect was that there is NO WARMING PLATE for the carafe. Once the coffee is brewed, the machine is OFF. The carafe is double wall insulated and keeps the coffee hot for hours. After living with a really low cost Mr. Coffee for years where the glass carafe dripped, the warmer corroded and the unit stayed on until you turned it off, I really appreciate this model.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin S. McGinnis

customer_reviews.title: Thermal carafe' = No Heater
customer_reviews.text: i like the machine, had an older version for 5 years and just replaced it. I didn't know that the maker did not include a 'hotplate' for the pot to sit on and remain warmed for x minutes, like the older one did. pros: quality of coffee taste - excellent; carafe keeps it warm through first cups poured cons: last cups poured are warm, not hot - prefer to have it on a hotplate or I need to drink faster... conclusion: i would purchase a hotplate maker next time, based on my preference for multiple cups of hot coffee.
customer_reviews.author: rschwan

customer_reviews.title: So far this is a wonderful coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a wonderful coffee machine. Love the fact that the coffee maker has a timer so the pot is ready when I get up. Also, I suggest you pay the extra money for the stainless steel carafe, it keeps coffee hot for a long time. The K cup side works great too. I did learn however do not pour more water in than the coffee cup you are using or it will overflow. Use the coffee cup you are going to use to load the water.
customer_reviews.author: David Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Very happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a broken drip coffee maker with this one, and was able to replace two machines with this one (keurig and drip coffee maker). I love that I can use a filter with the single serve side. My husband and I each drink different coffee (one is decaf, the other regular), so this coffeemaker has been great for us. I do wish that brewing something on the single serve side didn't turn off the warmer on the carafe. You also can only brew on one side at a time. The flap on the single serve side is warped, I will contact manufacturer about a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: laffytaffy

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a regular coffee brewer, but is absolutely useless for k-cups. Takes a long time to brew, and stopped working altogether after about 40 uses. You will be disappointed with this. Buy another product.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapie

customer_reviews.title: Broken part
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this coffee maker because of the combination of carafe and single serve features. Unfortunately, there was a part broken on the coffee basket so I opted to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Gail L Cain

customer_reviews.title: Too much steam under cupboard
customer_reviews.text: We here do not use the K-cup as much as we thought we would, and it is tough to thoroughly clean the K-cup holder after use. Also the K-cup leaves granular sediment seen in the bottom of your cup, so I only give 4 stars for taste. My biggest gripe with it, is the steam it gives off, leaving the underside of the cupboard above it wet!! need to pull it out while brewing and for a while afterwards so it will not eventually damage the wood under the cupboards. Otherwise it does work well, and have not had any issues with it for the few months of using it once a day.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what's up with the complaints but I'm very pleased with my purchase. READ the instructions! I found unscrewing & removing the plastic grid over the water reservoir on the single serve side makes cleaning easier (I like to see what's lurking in there). My first experience with a thermal carafe, now THAT I am not thrilled about because it does not hold heat well but I happen to have a separate, flat warming plate that solves that issue. I opted for the thermal simply because I do not want to have to track down a replacement glass carafe as these are not as readily available as brands like Mr. Coffee. Great purchase, highly reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 3 in 1 machine
customer_reviews.text: Crazy great if you ask me. Now guests at our vacay home can have the type of coffee they like. And, believe me, they all want it a special way. This thing replaces 3 separate machines on the counter (though we needed to add a heating milk foamer for those types), looks great, is easy to use. I can’t think of anything yet that’s wrong, although I wish there was a compartment somewhere to hold the extra components. Hoping no one will misplace them in the meantime. Fits nicely on the counter under the cupboards. So glad I came across this in my research to replace a regular coffee maker. It’s cool.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Macchiarella

customer_reviews.title: Forget the negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: If you get one that works perfectly like ours does, you will be happy. No leaks, no problems, and good coffee too. I like the program feature, and the k-cup/make your own k-cup is easy to use. I like pouring the exact amount of water i want in my k-cup. It does take a little longer to brew the K-cup than a Keurig, but it's isn't much longer. Maybe 30 seconds. Sort of like the single serving K-cup models.
customer_reviews.author: Shaffer Construction

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: Well now the carafe side leaked all the hot water all over my counter and floor. Tried again, same thing. So sad. Sadmad. Love everything about it except mine has a glitch. On the single serve side it always says to close the lid and it's already closed. I found the lil button on the inside of the lid and figured out how to push down really hard on the outside of the lid right in that spot before I hit brew and that'll get it going. Kind of a pain though. Everything else is great however. I enjoy the variety of brewing options and it makes a nice hot mug.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this except it doesn't stay warm long enough.
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this coffee maker except that it doesn't stay warm long enough. Once the coffee is finished brewing, it shuts off. It stays warm for a couple of hours which might be fine if you are done drinking coffee day before leaving for work. But I'm an early riser and my husband sleeps a couple of hours later so by the time he wakes up, the coffee needs to be warmed up in the microwave. We have the unit with the stainless steel carafe. I'm not sure if the unit with the glass carafe stays as warm. That's the only issue I have. Otherwise I love this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Terri A Euber

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Our Kuirig quit after a couple of years and although it was very convenient it didn’t make very good coffee. My wife like it though so I was looking for a coffee maker that did both. This is it. It’s a standard drip coffee maker and makes coffee with Kuirig pods. The thing that is really great is it makes single cups of coffee with real ground coffee. There are two different single use coffee strainers, one takes pods and the other a couple of spoonfuls of ground coffee. It has separate water reservoirs, that are both easy to fill unlike some regular coffee makers. For single use you use your cup so it’s always just enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Link

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this at all cost - MTBF about 3.5 months
customer_reviews.text: In 11 Months we have had THREE(3) of these POSes. First one failed in Four(4) months - Leaked water all over counter when making coffee from either K-Cup or Carafe. Second one failed in just three(3) months - K-Cup would no longer dispense. Yes! cleaned the needle and holder. Third one failed in four(4) months - Again, K-Cup section only delivered half of water from reservoir. Tossed this POS into trash and went back to a Keriug-Duo Esential from Wal-Mart. Wal-Mart branded Keirug was close to $100 cheaper than the version on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Krauss

customer_reviews.title: A Great Design
customer_reviews.text: There is one problem that seems to occur quite often with this model. The line from the carafe water tank to the heater element does not have a clamp on it and will eventually loosen. The result is that half the water goes to the basket--and the other half goes all over your counter top! It can be easily fixed. However, HB says the coffee maker is not "user serviceable", and if you open up the base, you will void the warranty. But if you're in the mood for coffee and want to slap a 1/4" clamp on that water line, be advised that the screws for the base take a Y1 or "tri-wing" screwdriver bit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy...but
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife for Christmas. We are totally over Tassimo and are going K-cup (the VHS vs. Betamax battle of single serve coffee I think is over) mostly due to the K-cup variety plus the easy of the "make your own" K-cup style" ground coffee filter included in this model. It has worked very well so far (about 3 weeks' use so far) with no complaints. Unless you count the fact that Sams's club was carrying it for about 40% off this price I paid. Other than that, this was a great purchase! Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: I am the one you warned me of

customer_reviews.title: love, Love, LOVE this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I love love LOVE this coffee maker! It's perfect having the option to do just one cup at a time or a whole pot. The pot can be programmed to have coffee ready by the time you wake....which is always lovely!! The one cup side comes with a basket to use your own coffee and a basket to insert k-cups. I absolutely love the versatility of this coffee maker! The stainless steel carafe matches my stainless kitchen appliances perfectly. Win win!!! And to clean it I just brew a pot/cup of white vinegar followed with a pot/cup of plain water.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this coffee maker Nov. 1017 but didn’t start to use it until my kitchen was completed in February 2018. Worked great until yesterday when for some reason it flooded the counter with water. Upon inspection, the water tank had cracked. It held cold water but as soon as it began to heat, water went everywhere from under the machine. 1.5 years of use is not acceptable when I’ve had machines last for years. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: wchp1963

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I bought this. I’ve been wanting a Keurig but didn’t want to spend a coin on it. This is perfect it has a time or you can set the coffee to brew automatically in the morning either in the craft or in a cup. Also you don’t have to buy the pods to use it just to fill a cup because it comes with a filter so you can use a pod or you can put your own coffee in the filter and brew a cup. Also it come accommodates Toller cups like travel cups the platform slips right off so you can fit just about any size cup in there that you would want
customer_reviews.author: MortgageAngel

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted exactly four months..four long annoying months..do not buy this coffee maker. I’m usually very good with my product research and ordering but I messed up on this one..will NEVER buy another Hamilton Beach product. The regular coffee make works alright but is very slow..the single serve works when it feels like it. Also has a constant high pitch noise from the machine..never been happier than to throw this thing in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks in less than one year
customer_reviews.text: I am totally disappointed, I bought this item in October 2018, it was a present for my daughter, today she told me that the coffee maker broke 10 months later, she said that it just stopped working, I didn't know that Hamilton is making such unreliable items I wished she would have told me sooner so I could have tried to get it replaced
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bee

customer_reviews.title: Think twice before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: After having a Kerrigan I thought this would be great because you can make a whole pot or a cup. Hated the taste of the coffee that I have used for years. The brewer would be ok if they can put a water reservoir like Keurig. Each time you want a single cup you have to pot in the correct amount of water. For me that meant I had to pull the unit out from under the cabinets to get to the water reservoir in the back. I used it for about a month and it’s now packed in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma 2 one

customer_reviews.title: Almost sent it back...
customer_reviews.text: Using the single serve on the FlexBrew was spitting coffee and water out every time we used it, + grounds in the coffee. Very upsetting. Thinking that it could be the k-pod, we searched for a solution, before deciding if we would return the flexbrew. We purchased ASIN #B07SMMH8G7 (Perfect Pod Cafe Save Reusable K Cup Pod Coffee Filters) These work perfectly. Good cup of coffee every time! No spitting water and coffee and no coffee grounds!
customer_reviews.author: Iris Flower

customer_reviews.title: Good...almost excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is easy to use and as easy to clean as any other coffee maker. It’s a good quality product. There is one decision made for me by the manufacturer that I really don’t like. They decided that I would not want to set an automatic brew time if I only wanted to make one cup. The maker thus does not have that functionality. This is something that I would use most days if I had that function available. It is an unfortunate decision that had I known about before hand would possibly have influenced me to purchase a different product. It’s still a quality product though.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Carleton

customer_reviews.title: A Less Expensive Way to Get THREE Ways to Make Your Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker answers all my needs. It's definitely 'FLEXIBLE' The Keurig ever seemed to make coffee strong enough for me and too strong for my friends that visit. This coffee maker gives you the option to make a full pot, which lasts for hours in the insulated carafe, or you can make individual servings. There is a pod attachment and also an attachment for ground coffee. The attachment can make one cup of any size or a small thermos that fits neatly under it by removing the lifted base. I can finally have coffee my way! After the first cup, I gave the Keurig away!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Yes !! Love it !! I like that there are more than one way to use it. Just a bit slower than my old kurig. But the convenience is sure worth it. 3 ways to get a cup of coffee. If you run out of K cups you can still get a great cup of coffee with their filter. This is great when I grind my own coffee. I sure would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: landa webb

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Keurig by a mile
customer_reviews.text: Disgusted with the Keurig brand because the top of the line model would only last a year and a half, and Keurig wouldn't honor any kind of warranty, or support, I went looking. My wife loves the ability to make single cups of coffee or tea, and she still had a large amount of the K cups. This thing is AWESOME! It eliminates the need for 2 different machines. We threw out the Keurig, and gave away the coffee maker. She can make a single cup for herself, and a pot of coffee for family or friends. the coffee maker is faster than the coffee maker we used to have. It brews a K cup faster than the Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Fuel683

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic coffee machine!
customer_reviews.text: For coffee lovers like my boyfriend and I this machine is perfect!!! We always polish off a full pot of coffee on the weekends and used to make a second pot and not be able to finish it. Now we can just have an extra cup or two and no waste! Also great if you’re just in the mood for a cup of coffee any tome of day. Any k cups work in it and the flavor is amazing! This will be an item in my kitchen for the rest of my life!
customer_reviews.author: CCG78

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee maker, has k-cups, single cup brew container, and makes a regular 12-cup pot. No complaints what-so-ever. The only thing i couldn't help but notice is that is makes this very subtle high pitch ringing when its on. I didn't notice it at first but once my wife pointer it out I can't get the ringing out of my head. I simply unplug it when not being used and it solved the problem. not enough for me to take a star off though because overall this coffee maker is great regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 49976 FlexBrew Coffee Maker, Single Serve & Full 12 Pot, Compatible for K-Cup Pods or Grounds, Black
product_meta.description: No two Coffee drinkers are the same So when you make Coffee at home, the flexibility to customize how and what you brew is key. From fresh grounds to K-Cup pods, the FlexBrew 2-way Coffee maker gives you the options to please fans of all types of coffees.
feature_bullets: Two ways to brew: Brew a full pot using your favorite grounds on the carafe side, or make a cup for yourself using a k-cup pod or grounds on the single serve side with this 2 in 1 coffee maker

Single-serve: Brew with K-Cup Pods or without. Pod holder and single serve grounds basket are included. Features cup rest that adjusts to fit tall mugs and doubles as storage. Pod piercing needle removes for easy cleaning to prevent clogging
12 cup carafe side: Features programmable timer, auto pause and serve and 2 hour auto shutoff
Separate water reservoirs: Each brewer has its own water reservoir that’s easy to fill and features a water window, so you always know which brewer has how much water

Brewing flexibility: The Hamilton beach Flexbrew 2 way coffee maker has the option to please fans of all types of coffees and quantities, making it the perfect gift for a home with multiple coffee drinkers

Single serve brew time: In about 3 minutes, Flexbrew makes a strong, great-tasting cup of coffee, and you save energy because rather than heating water continuously, Flexbrew only heats the water when you're ready to brew
Keurig and k-cup are registered trademarks of Keurig green mountain, inc. Use of the Keurig and K-cup. Trademarks does not imply any affiliation with or endorsement by Keurig green mountain
